channel.title: japanese on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in japanese on Barefoot Rob

item.title: Ghost Pancakes to learn Japanese
item.description:
22:19 Sunday 21 April 2019 JST One of my Japanese teachers had suggested learning through songs, so I have decided to learn this song (found by searching “Japanese songs learning” or something) Hmmm it is pretty easy. This one is way more challenging for me, but I learned the refrain ages (15 years?) ago.
ペッパー警部 邪魔をしないで ペッパー警部 私たちこれから いいところ あなたの言葉が 注射のように 私の心にしみている ああ きいている むらさきいろした たそがれ時が グラビアみたいに 見えている ああ 感じてる その時なの もしもし君たち 帰りなさいと 二人をひきさく声がしたのよ アアア ペッパー警部 邪魔をしないで ペッパー警部 私たちこれから いいところ ペッパー警部 邪魔をしないで ペッパー警部 私たちこれから いいところ 愛しているよと 連発銃が 私を殺してしまいそう ああ 負けそうよ 都会の空では 奇跡のような 星空ひろがる 夏の夜 ああ 夢みたい その時なの もしもし君たち 帰りなさ いと 夢からうつつに戻されたのよ アアア ペッパー警部 邪魔を しないで ペッパー警部 私たちこれから いいところ

item.title: assuming the worst
item.description: 23:01 Thursday 27 September 2018 JST I do not normally catastrophize things, but I am assuming my favorite Japanese teacher got fed up with me not studying much the past few weeks. At the same time, I didn’t notice that our lesson package on iTalki had run out of lessons, so (even though she had said this timeslot was always reserved for me) that was not the case today, it seems.

item.title: wrote sentences
item.description: 11:46 Tuesday 20 March 2018 JST Excuse me, I noticed a mosquito biting I may be wrong but in this environment, business meetings may go pear shaped Catching the mozzy would be good I think すみません、蚊の刺す事を気が付来ました。 間違えるかも知らないけど この環境で会議はちょっとめちゃくちゃになる。 蚊が捕まったらいいと思います。 These cats are keeping me from getting ready. 猫はジャマだから準備ができない。 Long ago, my colleage used to work at a far away factory. 昔々私の同僚は遠い工場に働きました。 uh oh - gotta change the baby's diaper あっ赤ちゃんが着替えないといけない。 bullying is terrible いじめる事はひどいと思います。 A burglar stole my homework 泥棒が私の宿題を盗んだ。

item.title: email to fuchan
item.description: 15:55 Monday 11 December 2017 JST こんにちは 返事が遅くてすみません！返事がもっと遅かったら、 赤ちゃんはもう大人になってしまいますね。 お父さんとお母さんも近くよかったです。来週は妻の父に会うのため外 国に行きます。しかし最近朝の５：４５出るけど、冬ちゃんのお父さん会えな い。残念。彼ら、元気？ それでは ロブ

item.title: studied japanese
item.description: 10:20 Tuesday 31 October 2017 JST There are errors in the Japanese below!

item.title: early study
item.description: 05:07 Tuesday 24 October 2017 JST Woke up at 5am to study.

item.title: Studied Japanese
item.description: 19:19 Monday 11 September 2017 JST I might be back on a study mode. This time, I plan to learn some transitive verbs without learning their intransitive verb partners at the same time. There are probably errors in the notes below! 開ける open something ドアを開けて、下さい。 Please open the door. 窓を閉めて、ください。 Please close the window. 今日、電気をつけて、虫が入った。 Today I turned on the light and a bug came in. (and I used an intransitive verb.

item.title: 日本語を勉強しました
item.description: 12:08 Wednesday 06 September 2017 JST There are probably errors in the Japanese notes below! きょう、「今日、東京の教員が京都の病院で競争するそうです。」遅くで書いた。 林さんは怪しい早口ことばを書いた。 すもももももももものうち

item.title: sazaesan map from onesan
item.description: 15:48 Friday 13 January 2017 JST Lin’s sister gave me a map of Japan after I saw a copy of it at her house. Neat! Maybe I’ll learn a few tidbits about Japan.

item.title: lesson last night
item.description: 14:26 Wednesday 28 December 2016 JST I really like my new Japanese teacher Fumiko. She’s apparently got a certificate or license to teach Japanese, and it shows. BUT I correctly identified 苦手 as an adjective while she thought it was a noun for a second. (not noun/名刺 mixup) Anyway, I might be learning at a fractionally faster rate.

item.title: Growth via mikoshi
item.description: 00:07 Monday 03 August 2015 JST Today I saw some people carrying a mikoshi, so I stopped and broadcast them on Periscope for a bit LIVE on #Periscope: Mikoshi https://t.co/cNZk91Vr0B — Rob Nugen (@thunderrabbit) August 2, 2015 Then I talked to them as they were finishing before lunch. They invited me to join them when they started again at 1pm. Before I left, a guy came up, “do you remember me?

item.title: Delvin Language
item.description: 08:55 Tuesday 07 July 2015 JST I found https://delvinlanguage.com/ on /r/learnjapanese, and after trying it out, like it a lot! Russ from Delvin sent me two challenging listening exercises. https://delvinlanguage.com/data/segment/225/ https://delvinlanguage.com/data/segment/20/ Try listening to the video without reading the transcription below it.

item.title: Japanese class at 80s cafe
item.description: 21:36 Wednesday 15 April 2015 JST Lin came with me today to 80s Cafe for Japanese class! She said she enjoyed it a lot and will come to Chinese class on Saturdays if she has time. We sat at a table with ドアンさん and にこにこさん. Nikoniko was quite fluent in Japanese, though his native language is Chinese. Adan is French, and his English is quite good. His Japanese is a bit above my level.
